meanings.definition: A common eye condition that causes blurred vision due to an irregularly shaped cornea or lens.
meanings.sent1: My brother wears glasses to correct his astigmatism.
meanings.sent2: The optometrist diagnosed her astigmatism during the eye exam.
meanings.sent3: The astigmatism in my eye makes me see the world like a blurry painting.
meanings.sent4: Her astigmatism was like looking through a foggy window, distorting everything in sight.
meanings.sent5: The astigmatism in his vision made the world appear like a fuzzy photograph.

meanings.definition: The inability of a lens or mirror to bring light rays from one point to a single focus.
meanings.sent1: The camera lens had astigmatism, causing the photos to be out of focus.
meanings.sent2: The telescope's astigmatism made it difficult to observe distant stars clearly.
meanings.sent3: The astigmatism in the mirror made my reflection look like a funhouse distortion.
meanings.sent4: Her mind's astigmatism scattered thoughts like light rays bouncing off a broken mirror.
meanings.sent5: The astigmatism of the projector lens created a blurry image on the screen.
